Potential Impact on Your Professional Practice

GETCA 2019

Greetings, colleagues, and welcome to the 93st annual Greater Edmonton Teachers’ Convention.

Question: Why do you love to attend GETCA?

1. I always look forward to convention as an opportunity to spend time with colleagues.
2. I learn about new and latest trends in education.
3. I become inspired by new ideas for my classroom.
4. Display land!
5. All of the above and more!

Teachers are the single most important contributor to learner success. Teachers challenge students, inspire, motivate and plant the seeds for lifelong learning. So where does a teacher gain his/her energy, inspiration and ideas from?

Opportunity for quality professional development (PD) through teachers’ convention is a great place to start.

Your colleagues on the GETCA organizing committee have been delivering quality PD for 90 years! It should stagger your mind to think of the number of Alberta teachers who have had their lives and teaching practice influenced by this annual conference. I thank and salute each of the members of GETCA for all of their year long work that culminates in this convention.

I trust that this convention will help you enhance your practice, recharge your batteries and catch up on those often neglected collegial relations. I hope you enjoy your time at convention and thank you for the important work you do with Alberta students.

On behalf of Provincial Executive Council, greetings and welcome to GETCA 2019.


Greg Jeffery
President
Alberta Teachers’ Association

Do I have to attend convention?

All certified teachers employed in Alberta\'s public school boards have a legal and professional obligation to attend their designated teachers\' convention each year. These two convention days are paid days of work. Being absent from convention can result in unprofessional conduct consequences including lost wages, fines, termination and removal of certification. If there is a unique professional development opportunity at the same time as convention, a teacher must apply for alternate PD. The application will be granted or denied. The form can be found on the website under Alternate PD at www.getca.com

Who can come to convention?

All Certified teachers employed by Edmonton Public, Edmonton Catholic, Fort McMurray Public and Fort McMurray Catholic Schools.

Student teachers for the University of Alberta who are in their final practicum during convention can attend. Convention ID\'s are given out at the student union office at the U of A.

Substitude teachers can attend. Convention ID\'s can be picked up at the ATA local office in Barneet house, substitute teachers meeting or at the info desk at converion. An ATA membership card, school board ID or proof of employment are required.

Teachers on leave if they are on maternity leave, unpaid leave or professional improvement leaves can attend if the have paid their local union dues for the year. Convention ID\'s con be picked up at the ATA local office in Barnett house or at the info desk at convention. An ATA membership card, school board ID or proof of employment are required.

A teach on Medical Leave is not able to attend convention because, contractually, convention days are paid days of work. If a teacher on medical leave attends convention they would be expected to return to work the next school day after convention.

Teachers who are not employed by Alberta schools can attend if they meeet all requirements for Out of District registration. There is a fee involved. Go to www.getca.com and click on Out of Distriction Registration for more details.

Can I bring my child to convention?

No. Convention is a paid work day. Arrangements for child care during convention are the same as during a day of school. Teachers who bring children to convention will be asked to leave and will be contacted by a provincial ATA staff officer.

How is convention funded?

Each year GETCA receiveds funding from convention fees paid by members of the ATA locals for Edmonton and Fort McMurray, as well as registrations and exhibitors. A big part of the fees are spent on speakers and speaker expenses including travel, accommodation and substitute release costs. Another large amount goes to paying for the facilities, rentals, audio-visual costs and printing. Other costs include website maintenance, app development, professional accounting and legal services, meeting costs and committee member expenses.

Is there free Wifi at the Shaw and Westin?

It is not free but we do have a certain number wireless connections available. Teachers are welcome to connect at the Shaw without a code and a code will be provided at the Westin info booth should you need it.

Why is there only an iPhone app?

This is our first year trying an app for convention. We are starting with the iPhone and will possibly add an android and/or blackberry app next year, depending on feed back.

Why are sessions I want always full?

Unfortunately, we cannot always predict the number of people that will find one session more interesting than another. We do our best with the information we have and the room sizes that are available. We ask that you have three options available for each time slot so that you have a plan when your first choice fills up.
